metadata.dc:author: García-Izquierdo, Antonio L
Pastor, Juan
metadata.dc:description: This article presents complexity (nonlinearity, chaos, self-organisation, fractals...) as a new and emerging epistemological paradigm, an alternative to an old, simpler, and reductionist paradigm. According to this point of view, we try to view work organizations as complex adaptive systems (CAS). Lastly, we offer a review of the literature on the applications of complexity to Organizational Social Psychology.
metadata.dc:title: Complejidad y Psicología Social de las Organizaciones.
[Complexity and social psychology of organizations].
